name: Mosaic Hotel Beverly Hills

reviews.title: Loved the Mosaic Hotel in Beverly Hills, Ca
reviews.text: The Mosaic is a true gem in the heart of Beverly Hills. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and always had a smile. My room was incredible - it had all of luxury features you would expect from 5 star hotel: high quality bed linens, tiled shower with granite counter tops, plasma screen TV's and Voss water!

LOVE this hotel. Friendly, accomodating staff in a lovely sunny yellow building with tons of charm. The location could not be better. A request to the GM resulted in his going above and beyond to take care of us. We will recommend this hotel to everyone. Thanks Mosaic Hotel!!
reviews.title: Perect A+
Do not understand all the good reviews
reviews.text: My wife and I were very excited to stay at the Mosaic on our first trip to the L.A. area. We read all kinds of reviews on this site and on others and decided that The Mosaic was where we would stay. We were very disappointed in our stay. The front desk is not helpful at all and I think only about 3 people work in the hotel at any one time. The bellboy is also the valet and also one of the front desk employees. Also, the rooms are very, very small as well as the bathrooms and we are staying in one of the deluxe corner rooms. We looked at switching to the Beverly Wilshire, but they were booked during the week we were in town, so we decided to stay, but it will be the last time I stay at The Mosaic. Stay somewhere else because The Mosaic is greatly overrated.

We stayed at the Mosaic February 9 & 10 2006 with another couple prior to embarking on a cruise and cannot say enough about this facility. We contacted Brendan Carlin, the general manager, by e-mail back in November to make the reservation and he put us directly in touch with Nadeev the Front Desk Manager to make tour and transportation arrangements as well. Everything went absolutely perfectly - from the airport pickup to the limo ride to the pier. On arrival, we were welcomed as long-time guests from the outset. The rooms were outstanding (one corner room and one one-bedroom suite) with exceptional amenities. Lunch and breakfast was excellent with top-notch service. Nadeev made a point of introducing himself shortly after our checkin and we were made to feel extremely welcome.
reviews.title: What A Fabulous Experience!
Great two week stay..
reviews.text: Our tour tickets and transportation were all in order just as requested and staff made an excellent restaurant recommendation at the nearby Crustacean.

I was in Beverly HIlls for a second medicl opinion. I did a lot of research on hotels,, read the great reviews of this one, and decided to give it a try. When my husband and I arrived at 1pm there was not a room available. No problem. We knew it was early. We left our luggage and went out shopping. When we returned at 3 pm our room was ready. We had specifically asked for a very quiet room. During check-in we again requested a quiet room. We were told no problem. There were two men at two desks doing check-ins. One was helping us and the other was taking calls. At one point the two men began chatting and seemed to forget there were customers in front of them. We were handed keys to the room without even being asked for a credit card. OK. A third man said he would take us to our room. We waited at least 5 minutes for the one elevator. When we arrived in our room we asked the bellman if the room was going to be quiet. He assured us that it was one of the quietest rooms in the hotel. The hotel room was very small and cramped. Frankly, it reminded me of my grandma's guest bedroom. Everything seemed kind of old and worn. The bathroom, however, was large and modern. It did not seem to go with the rest of the room. I layed down to try to take a nap, but within 10 minutes hammering began. It would intermittently stop for a minute or two and then begin again. After 20 minutes of it I could not take it anymore. My husband called the front desk to ask what was going on. The front desk staff was clueless. My husband asked for the manager. The manager said they were replacing the carpet on the floor above us and the work would likely be done around 5pm, but would begin again in the morning. We explained that we had requested a quiet room -several times. Nobody in the hotel seemed to think that having a work crew hammering above us for hours on end was a big deal. We asked for another room, but were told none were available. After 90 minutes of hammering and back and forth with the manager we checked ot and went to stay at the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza which was a better, bigger room with new furniture at half the cost with 100% less snottiness.

reviews.title: Great stay at the Mosaic

reviews.text: Brendan and his team always make us feel welcome, nothing is too much to ask for. They deserve their number 1 rating.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Beverly Hills

reviews.text: I took my mom to the Mosaic for a girls’ weekend in Los Angeles, where my daughter lives. I wanted something special without paying the very high rates at the Bel-Air, Peninsula, or Beverly Wilshire. The staff is very friendly and helpful, making us feel very welcome. The room was lovely, well decorated and elegant. Yes, it's small, as is the bathroom, but the charm and style of the appointments made up for it. We were on the level with a patio, which was also nice. The extra touches--Mercedes car service to restaurants in the area, Bulgari toiletries, a thermos of tea at night--set this hotel apart. We were very pleased with our stay overall, and I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Charming and elegant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I couldn't have been more impressed with this hotel. Awesome staff, willing to help with anything, and extremely friendly. Inviting front-desk. Incredible bartenders serving delicious bloody mary's and any concoction you can come up with. The pool area was on the smaller side, providing an intimate and cozy setting. BEAUTIFULLY decorated and surrounded by plants. Comfortable lounge chairs and little nooks for privacy. Sunbathe, or enjoy drinks by the pool at night. The rooms were very modernly decorated with comfortable beds. The bathrooms were simply amazing. Great lobby area. Overall, the place was extremely clean, cozy, inviting, stylish, friendly, and professional. I loved the staff here and hope to see them again! Thanks for a wonderful weekend!
reviews.title: Great atmosphere and an awesome staff!

likes.liked: — the amazing staff, beautiful decor, and the ambiance

reviews.text: My 2 friends and I stayed at the Mosaic Hotel Sept.12th-16th. I can not rave enough on how wonderful the staff and our stay was. We booked the packaged that included Mercedes car rental. Soon as we got our luggage the rental car place had a sign waiting for us. Soon as we entered the Mosaic we where treated like high class celebrities. The staff is so helpful and friendly. When you needed directions the front desk printed them up for you. The also have a car service that will take you anywhere and pick you up in a four mile radius. That was excellent for when we had dinner at Mr.Chow. The room is small but cozy and comfortable. The bed is so soft, you just fall alseep putting your head on the pillow. The pool area is extremely small but we liked that because it was more inviting. The drinks where excellent...the food was excellent. Multiple times we called the front desk for hot water and tea and in 1 min they are at our door with it. We all loved it here. I cant wait to go back. Trust me anyone who is going to stay in Beverly Hills stay at the Mosaic Hotel. It is in walking distance to everything in Beverly Hills, it is a short drive to the airport and everything in west hollywood. A++++++ to all the staff members here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had heard good things about the Beverly Hills Hilton, however could not get a reservation for our dates of travel to Los Angeles. With a preference to stay in the Beverly Hills area, we came across the Mosaic and we were not disappointed. It was a lovely hotel, with recently renovated rooms, great customer service by hotel staff and quality room facilities. The driver service offered by the hotel to clients was fantastic as it saved us quite a sum of money not having to call taxi's for the short trips. The hotel was in short walking distance to the glitz and glamour of Rodeo Drive and the restaurants on Cannon. Starbucks is located around the corner for those patrons chasing cheap breakfast/lunch etc. Front Desk staff were fantastic in recommending nearby quality restaurants. We can highly recommend La Dolce Vita located on Santa Monica Blvd (one block from the hotel) - for anyone with a taste for excellent quality Italian food. It was so good we dined there two nights in a row. The hotel and surrounding streets were very clean and well kept. A highly recommended hotel and location for travellers chasing good service, top location and comfortable rooms.
reviews.title: Will stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Mosaic Dec 29 - Jan 3rd, 2009 after reading several positive reviews on Trip Advisor. This is a very long review so sit tight and enjoy.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: At first we were hesitant as we tend to stay at franchised hotels i.e. Sheraton, Hilton, Marriott etc. was attracted to the Mosaic b/c of the positive reviews on Trip Advisor, its proximity to Rodeo, Canon, Wilshire area, and the great deal that we were offered when we called the hotel after American Express had recommended the hotel to us. We ended up paying USD320 (plus tax) for 5 nights which included breakfast (many great breakfast options to choose from) with the 5th night free - can't beat that in Beverly Hills. We only ate breakfast at the hotel which I can say we enjoyed all week (tried different breakfast options every morning since it was included in our price). I read some reviews that the lunch/dinner was not so great, so can't comment as we only ate breakfast, but based on that I can't imagine lunch/dinner not tasting good but whatever...
reviews.title: Little Gem!

reviews.text: We arrived and realized its a boutique hotel with only 49 rooms which is nice, we checked in with ease, was helped to our room by Steve the doorman that night, the room itself was a decent size, king size bed, with 2 large chairs to sit on, large flatscreen TV, the washroom had marble floor/counter, shower was waterfall style which we really liked. The staff is excellent, very friendly, helpful, all the guys - Steve, Ben, Andrew, Collin, made our stay very pleasant. They have a complimentary shuttle service (which is a four door mercedes) and will drop you off and pick up within a 3 miles radius, no charge off course but we would tip $3-$5 depending on how far they would drop us. Taxi would cost more than double to those same distances and these guys offer the service for free!!! We have stayed in many hotels in 2008 I calculated I stayed in 7 different hotels averaging 3 nights per hotel (for both work and pleasure) and not one offered the free shuttle service - - so you got to give these guys credit for thinking outside the box. Again, all the guys were helpful and gave good tips on the city, so talk to them and they will be very helpful I guarantee that..
reviews.title: Highly Disappointing Trip

reviews.text: We take a few 'in-town' getaways each year, and since we have added a third traveler to our holiday adventures, things have gotten more complicated. Our recent addition is an eleven pound "Dachshuahua" - a half Chihuahua, half Dachshund mix who has better travel manners than ANY child and most adults. But even though she is an experienced, well behaved, and charming travel companion, our options are now limited in all areas; hotels, restaurants, activities, etc.
reviews.title: Four Seasons alternative? .... it worked for us
Best kept secret in LA
reviews.text: For the two-plus years since "Budley" has joined the party, we have made the Los Angeles Four Seasons our 'home away from home.' Only twenty minutes from our section of the Hollywood Hills, the Four Seasons has a well-deserved reputation for all-around excellence, AND they have a great Pets policy. They do all of the little things that make travelling with a pet easy and enjoyable, and they do it without needless daily surcharges or absurd 'cleaning fees."

reviews.title: Abso;utely Fell in Love with The Mosaic
reviews.text: But as the economy has hummed along for those at the top, luxury places like the 4 Seasons have found that they do not need to offer any 'deals' to attract guests. The weekend packages that used to get us into this hotel for under $300 per night are long gone. With taxes, fees and reasonable in-room charges, it now costs well over $500 per night to stay there. For those of us who were staying "above our income level' when at the 4 Seasons, this means that we now save it for one or two special occasions per year. And we needed to find something a little more reasonable for 4th of July weekend.

We found the special pet features offered by the W hotel in Westwood to be very interesting, but their $25/day pet surcharge PLUS $100 cleaning fee meant that a two day stay would cost an extra $150 for the dog! Fortunately, the Mosaic Hotel in Beverly Hills came to the rescue. For $275 per day, with NO charges for our dog, they welcomed all three of us.

The charm and quaintness of the property is gives it a warm, out of the way feel, yet as soon as you step outside of the hotel, you're in the heart of BH. I can't wait to return.

A Jewel!
reviews.text: My husband, teenage son and myself visited this boutique hotel for 5 days during the Christmas holiday and we took two rooms. We were very impressed with the overall experience, particularly the level of service and warm welcome extended by all members of the staff. The location is ideal for exploring all that the area has to offer - close enough to walk to shopping and restaurants yet far enough from the madding crowds! The hotel was chic and comfortable at the same time, very intimate and inviting. The rooms were beautifully decorated and our beds were so comfortable! The courtyard pool setting was a big attraction for us even though it was cool - the cabana type seating and heaters made it great and we enjoyed the best pizza there. Breakfast in the dining room was lovely with the view over the pool, and they served wonderful coffee. It was a pleasure to get back to the hotel every day - it felt like a luxurious home away from home.
